security: Revealing that Sea Dads Industries is a cover corporation (referred to as "backstop WAVE cover corp.") could compromise ongoing operations and damage the CIA's reputation. Quoting directly: "Requested PCSA/CSA for Frank M. WARREN, Jr., Sea Dads Industries, Miami to backstop WAVE cover corp."
summary: A classified message grants PCSA/CSA (Permanent Contact Security Approval/Controlled Source Agent) for Frank M. Warren, Jr. of Sea Dads Industries to support a WAVE cover corporation.
summary_one_paragraph: This classified message, dated December 16, 1963, indicates that PCSA/CSA (Permanent Contact Security Approval/Controlled Source Agent) has been granted for Frank M. Warren, Jr., associated with Sea Dads Industries in Miami. This approval is to provide support, described as 'backstopping,' for a WAVE cover corporation, suggesting the company is being used for clandestine operations.
title: PCSA Granted for Frank M. Warren, Jr. to Backstop WAVE Cover Corp.
